Sentencas: To efficiently assess the mechanical reliability and long-term durability of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) and solid oxide electrolyser cells (SOECs), a suitable creep test method and prediction of the material response is necessary.
Titulo: Creep constitutive law prediction via short-term evaluation using a small size testing method

Sentencas: This study investigates the effectiveness of the small punch (SP) testing method for Ni-YSZ composites and in rapidly determining the constitutive creep law for SOFC materials.
Titulo: Creep constitutive law prediction via short-term evaluation using a small size testing method

Sentencas: The creep properties of Ni-YSZ composites are evaluated under a 1% H2 environment at temperatures of 800-900 degrees C and stresses of 36-58 MPa.
Titulo: Creep constitutive law prediction via short-term evaluation using a small size testing method

Sentencas: The finite element method is used to simulate the SP tests and generate numerical creep curves.
Titulo: Creep constitutive law prediction via short-term evaluation using a small size testing method

Sentencas: These curves are fitted to the experimental curves to obtain the parameter set in the creep constitutive law of the strain hardening model.
Titulo: Creep constitutive law prediction via short-term evaluation using a small size testing method

Sentencas: The numerical and experimental creep curves are well-fitted with only a 0.44% difference and convergent parameter sets equal to C1 = 1.0 x 10-12, C2 = 1.03, C3 = -1.70, C4 = 96.78 in the strain hardening law, indicating the usefulness of the SP method and creep constitutive law for characterising and predicting the creep properties of SOFC constituent materials.
Titulo: Creep constitutive law prediction via short-term evaluation using a small size testing method

Sentencas: This study highlights the importance of accurate characterisation of creep properties for predicting the long-term performance and reliability of SOFCs.& COPY; 2023 The Author(s).
Titulo: Creep constitutive law prediction via short-term evaluation using a small size testing method
